Division is the inverse of multiplication.  
If we ask “what number times \(-3\) gives \(-12\)?” the answer must be **+4**, because  

\[
(+4)\times(-3)= -12.
\]

If we tried \(-4\) instead, we would get  

\[
(-4)\times(-3)=+12,
\]

which is the opposite of what we started with. The two negatives in the *division* therefore “cancel,” just like they do in multiplication.
